item.title: My Second Test Post
item.description: My second post. This time after having pushed all the staged changes in the public directory then placing public/ in the .gitignore file. Just see what will happen. Also, this post as .Rmd.

item.title: Pasting in an Rmd
item.description: title: “Mike’s Test R Markdown Doc” author: “Mike Hudson” date: “28/09/2020” output: html_document knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE) R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document.

item.title: Pasting in an Rmd Part 2
item.description: R Markdown testing This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

item.title: Second Test again
item.description: My second post. This time after having pushed all the staged changes in the public directory then placing public/ in the .gitignore file. Just see what will happen. Also, this post as .Rmd. Updating this post so it has category of madman and extra tag of sardine.

item.title: Third post md not Rmd
item.description: My third post. This one down in md format not Rmd. Seems that when I use R Markdown an html file is built and placed in the content/blog folder but not when md is used.

item.title: This time in content blog
item.description: Another attempt. This time in content > blog. I quit the night job today.

item.title: About
item.description: I am currently learning R and other things that go along with that, such as data wrangling and analysis, using r markdown to create notes and documents, blogdown to create this website, shiny, ggplot2, etc. I will demonstrate some of my skills in the projects section of this website. I am currently studying for a B. Science with a major in statistics at University of Southern Queensland, Australia. My other interests include bushwalking, playing chess, and drawing/animating.

item.title: CodeRag
item.description: Not sure what I’ll use this page for yet.
